name: South American Tapir
description: The South American Tapir is a herbivore with a short trunk, known for its swimming ability.
spread_note: Found in South America, from Colombia to Brazil.
food_note: Forages near water, often at night.
proportions: Length: 1.8-2.5 m, height: 80-110 cm, weight: 200-350 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 13 months, one calf born.
attractions: Common in zoos for their quirky appearance.
projects_note: Vulnerable due to habitat loss; conservation is active.
breeding: Bred in captivity for zoos and conservation.
